isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - REASSEMBLE - INSTALL DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING (WITHOUT DIFFERENTIAL LOCK)

svcproc.title: INSTALL DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING (WITHOUT DIFFERENTIAL LOCK)

warning.para: Be careful when using cleaning solvents. Follow the solvent manufacturer's instructions for safe use to prevent injury.

step1.para: Clean the inside of axle housing and the mounting surface where the carrier fastens. Use a cleaning solvent and rags to remove dirt. Blow dry the cleaned areas with air. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT.
Inspect the axle housing for damage. Repair or replace the axle housing. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT.
Check for loose studs * in the mounting surface of the housing where the carrier fastens. Remove and clean the studs * that are loose.

Apply Heavy Duty Lock N' Seal No. 277 to the threaded holes and install the studs * into axle housing. Refer to INSTALL NEW DRI-LOC FASTENERS. Tighten studs * to correct torque value. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Apply silicone gasket material to the mounting surface of the housing where the carrier fastens ( Figure 134). Refer to APPLICATION OF SILICONE GASKET MATERIAL.

figure.caption: Figure 134. Apply Silicone Gasket Material to Mounting Surface

step1.para: Install the carrier into the axle housing. Use a hydraulic roller jack or a lifting tool.

caution.para: Do not install the carriers using a hammer or mallet. A hammer or mallet will damage the mounting flange of carrier and cause oil leaks.

step1.para: Install nuts * and washers or capscrews and washers in the four corner locations around the carrier and axle housing ( Figure 135).

figure.caption: Figure 135. Install Nuts and Washers or Capscrews and Washers

step1.para: Carefully push the carrier into position. Tighten the four fasteners two or three turns each in a pattern opposite each other ( Figure 135).
Repeat Step 8 until the four fasteners are tightened.
Install the other fasteners and washers that hold the carrier in the axle housing. Tighten all fasteners to the correct torque value. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Connect the driveline universal joint to the pinion input yoke or flange on the carrier.
Install the gaskets and axle shafts into the axle housing and carrier. The gasket and flange of the axle shafts MUST fit flat against the wheel hub ( Figure 136). Refer to INSTALL AXLE SHAFTS.

figure.caption: Figure 136. Install Gaskets and Axle Shafts

step1.para: Install the capscrews and washers that hold the axle shaft to the wheel hub. Tighten capscrews to the correct torque value. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
If the wheel hubs have studs *, install the tapered dowels * at each stud and into the flange of the axle shaft. Use a punch or drift and hammer if needed.
Install the nuts * and washers on the studs*. Tighten nuts * to the correct torque value. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
